content: There have been a few people complaining about Rust being “broken” because aarch64-apple-darwin doesn’t have docs. Should we consider adding it, even though its tier 2?

• https://github.com/rust-lang/rustup/issues/2692#issue-829938556
  • https://users.rust-lang.org/t/problem-with-rust-in-apple-silicon/56535?u=shepmaster
I won’t be able to attend the meeting, but my inclination is we should build these.
I don't really want to add ad-hoc things to our tiering system, but we've long wanted to have the linux docs shipped for all targets we don't build "native" docs for
I just don't have bandwidth to implement that right now, and IIRC there's some open questions around how to precisely do so
In theory it could be a fallback in rustup itself.
can't attend today, sorry y'all
I admit to thinking that the meeting was... now
Maybe we're messed up due to DST?
yep, according to my EST-aware calendar entry it's in 1hr
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/242791-t-infra/topic/meeting.202021-03-01/near/227615228
hm, I guess we're following europe then?
The meetings were at 1pm in eastern coast of the us, and it is currently 1pm
I can't make 2pm today at least
I think we pinned to EST (which isn't dst-aware) rather than ET - thoughts @Jake Goulding?
well I can't make in an hour anyway, so we can do something impromptu now :)
I think the main item from me was the item in infra-private from the last week - I'll message pietro about that
on meeting timezone - I'd propose tracking ET so that we shift with US timezones
that's all from me - I'll come back later to see any follow up discussion and potentially follow up on timezones
My intent was that the meeting started 33 minutes ago :-)
We should calculate when the daylight saving difference changes between any 2 pairs of the team and declare those team holidays :-)
